title: Firefox não carrega com extensões
content:
Bom dia. Nos últimos dias tem ocorrido um problema extremamente frustrante para o qual não encontrei solução prática. Toda vez que reinicio meu sistema, ao abrir o navegador Firefox ele se recusa a carregar qualquer site enquanto minhas extensões estiverem ativadas. O navegador abre, como de costume, com uma aba nova, e ao lado esta página, que fica carregando pra sempre. Qualquer outra página que eu tente abrir também fica carregando pra sempre. A única coisa que aparece no console do navegador é:

Content-Security-Policy: As configurações da página bloquearam a execução de um manipulador de eventos (script-src-attr) porque viola a seguinte diretiva: “script-src resource: chrome:” Source: function() { [native code] }'

Já tentei desativar extensão por extensão, mas o navegador só volta a funcionar quando eu desativo todas ao mesmo tempo ou o reinicio em modo de segurança. Em seguida, reinicio em modo normal e tudo volta a funcionar "normalmente", porém com o agravante de que preciso sempre relogar em minha extensão do BitWarden e outras.

Gostaria de encontrar a solução, pois não queria ser obrigado a voltar a utilizar outro navegador no meu dia-a-dia. Obrigado!
creator: alestori7

title: Firefox Tabs Constantly / Randomly Crashing
content:
I would love for someone to help point me in the right direction as to why my Firefox tabs are constantly crashing, especially on high memory usage websites like webmail or youtube.

I'm wondering if it could be related to a potentially faulty processor, as I recently had to RMA my i9 14900k processor, and modify the bios for stability even after I got a replacement, just to get applications to stop crashing and the OS to stop blue-screening.

For the curious, my intel forum post about that issue. My system specs are included in there as well: https://community.intel.com/t5/Processors/i9-14900k-randomly-crashing/m-p/1593273/thread-id/71838

Firefox crash logs:

Some crash reasons listed are EXCEPTION_BREAKPOINT , EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ , and EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_WRITE .

title: Browser Console
content:
I want to programatically access the open tabs #document object by the Browser Console. I am in chrome://browser/content/browser.xhtml I fallow the docs in browser console: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/browser_console/index.html

Following the code: var newTabBrowser = gBrowser.getBrowserForTab(gBrowser.selectedTab); newTabBrowser.addEventListener("load", function() {

newTabBrowser.contentDocument.body.innerHTML = "

this page has been eaten

";

}, true); newTabBrowser.contentDocument.location.href = "https://mozilla.org/";

.contentDocument is null except if current tab is a page such as page about:config

Is there a way to allow chrome:// tab to access read only of the tabs #documents property using the console?

I understand that accessing it with javascript from the browser console would be a security issue. I want to bypass it to read, analize and compare dynamic data from the open tabs.

title: Can't open Firefox - it says it is already running and must be closed first
content:
For 2 days now I have a big problem! Firefox froze, and I ended up closing it with the programme manager. When I wanted to reopen I got this: Firefox est déjà en cours d’exécution mais ne répond pas. L’ancien processus Firefox doit être arrêté pour pouvoir ouvrir une nouvelle fenêtre. BUT - it refuses to close when I click on "close" (fermer).

I tried the programme manager - but Firefox isn't shown as being open.

I've made a back up of my profile. I can't delete parent.block ... I'm told "Firefox is running already" and I must close it. Every troubleshooting step comes to the same barrier to completing it! Almost all guide one from an open Firefox page - and I can't open Firefox! I can't "uninstall" for the same reason!

All my passwords are in Firefox - and I can't import them to Chrome without closing Firefox completely! I'm going mad - urgent need to access my passwords!
creator: Evelyn

title: How can I use Mozilla Firefox Developer Tools to optimize the performance and compatibility of a CapCut video embedded on my website?
content:
To optimize the performance and compatibility of a CapCut video embedded on your website using Mozilla Firefox Developer Tools, follow these steps:

1. Performance Tab: Analyze the loading times of your web page, including the CapCut video, to identify and address any delays. 2. Network Tab: Monitor resource loading and ensure that your video files and other assets are being efficiently served. 3. Inspector Tool: Review and adjust the HTML and CSS related to thevideo player to ensure it displays correctly across different browsers and devices. 4. Console: Check for any JavaScript errors or warnings that might affect video playback or user interactions. 5. Application Tab: Manage and inspect web storage or service workers to ensure smooth functionality and caching for the video content.

Using these tools helps ensure that your CapCut video performs well and is compatible with various browsers and devices.

title: No proper right click context menu when trying to save an image from google photos.
content:
Hello, I have encountered an issue on the google photos website. Allow me to explain by giving the scenario:

Lets say A shared an album with B thereby A being the owner and B being the collaborator.

When A right clicks an image within the gallery, in the right click menu he has the option to 'save image as'. It does not matter if A is the owner of said image or not.

If B wishes to do the same thing, he can only do so for images he uploaded aka that he owns. He cannot right click on the images A uploaded to save it. Instead he must use Shift + D. The right click context menu only shows "Save webpage as" so we cannot download anything.

I have tried to test it on other browsers and Firefox is the only one with this issue. For chromium based browsers it works perfectly normally.

title: Re recent  Firefox upgrade that does not now support Macos High Sierra 10.13.6
content: I have an old Mac which still works fine, but this latest change to Firefox sort of came out of the blue, so I had not prepared or considered buying an upgraded Mac? Then I saw that Firefox were offering a 2 month overlap solution, whereby I could download an Firefox ESR extension which I have since done, which seems to be working, albeit I have now found that it seems Microsoft (I hate those people) have interfered in that I can no longer format any Word documents as I have previously been able to do, when writing to clients using my business profile Matrix letterhead etc, moreover I also have a Skype phone (which is fully credited) yet now when I try to call someone on Skype, whilst I can hear them, they cannot hear me? So I am now wondering, whether your ESR temporary solution doesn't interface with those Microsoft products? I have tried speaking with Microsoft, but honestly it is like talking to a brick wall, as all they are interested in is forcing people like me to pay U.S.D $65 to speak with some Tech head who invariably doesn't know the answer anyway! I would very much appreciate your advise?

title: Firefox uses up all CPU and heats up the laptop if a page contains one anigif
content:
This is pretty much the same as https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/801343 back in Firefox 3.x → 4 times. I do recall having the same problem then, and disabling hardware acceleration did fix it back then, but it no longer does.

I’m currently on 115.3 ESR, but I’ve observed this for a while in Quantum (I don’t recall seeing it on Gecko with HW accel disabled).
